newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: CAM volume surges after block deal.
newsitem.headline: CAM volume surges after block deal.

text.p: Precision engineering company CAM International Holdings saw its trading volume surge after a block of six million shares was seen crossed at Singapore $1.02 early Friday mornings, dealers said.
At 0151 GMT, CAM was up Singapore S$0.065 to S$0.805 on volume of 12.7 million shares, including the block trade.
"I think some major shareholder could be reducing his stake," said one institutional dealer of the block deal.
CAM announced on Thursday it had formed a joint venture to produce vegatables and fruits using aeroponic technology, which allows crops to grow without pesticides, their roots suspended in the air.
Its chairman Raymond Chew told reporters the move was one way to be less dependent on the cyclical electronics industry.
CAM officials were not immediately available for comment.
